sys_metadata_link.payload:
Setup automatically sent outbound REST message to your postman mock server when incident record is created or updated with specific assignment group. Check your mock server for body of the request you sent, it should look like this: 

{
  "request_id": "a03b9c5f83941210ee9ce290ceaad355",
  "attempt": "1",
  "dip_package": "mock",
  "dip_case": "POST",
  "data": {
    "urgency": "2",
    "impact": "3",
    "priority": "4",
    "description": "Unable to access the shared folder. Please provide access.",
    "number": "INC0009009",
    "short_description": "Unable to access the shared folder."
  }
}
]]> true false not requested ca8c03c0932b02100580f55a7bba10e7 product false automatic Feature false Goal of this exercise is to create simple outbound message that is sent when specific assignment group on Incident record is set. For this purpose we will use DIP to automate the process and Postman mock server to check outbound messages. DIP user guide: https://docs.google.com/document/d/191_vbhNHEnmLbvatorY_dsSjJQcK5LSJUpAsWlouJjQ/edit Postman mock server guide: https://learning.postman.com/docs/designing-and-developing-your-api/mocking-data/setting-up-mock/ Requirements: 1. Create outbound REST message (POST) with Postman mock server as endpoint. 2. Create custom assignment group 'DIP technical'. 3. Create DIP package with outbound trigger where condition is assignment_group.name == "DIP technical". 4. Create DIP case using job "outbound blank" and REST message details and method you created in step 1. 5. Create mapping  for fields you want to see in the related table at the bottom of the form. Mapping document is in the attachment of this story. Hints: 1. When creating the triggers in DIP be aware that whole incident object is stored inside "job.input.data" object that is accessible throughout the whole DIP job. It acts simillar to GlideRecord and you can access specific values via dotwalking. For example to get assignment groups name you can use "job.input.data.assignment_group.name". 2. In the mapping table, in case of outbound message "source" field should hold system name of the fields from incident table you want to get data from. "Target" field is how the attribute will be named in the outgoing message 3. Rest message used in the case needs to be accessible in All scopes. 1970-01-02 00:00:00 2024-09-02 2024-09-02 09:30:30 39398b0c93e702100580f55a7bba1007 0 4000100000 false 3 false false true false STRY0010068 2024-09-02 09:30:30 6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441 200 false 48d09f08932b02100580f55a7bba10e9 0 4 3398874c93e702100580f55a7bba10c0 1900000 0 false true 2024-09-02 09:30:30 2024-09-02 09:30:30 false Setup automatic outbound REST message 48d09f08932b02100580f55a7bba10e9 200000 2024-09-02 2024-09-02 09:30:30 1 green rm_story admin 2024-09-02 09:32:13 global / 62accbc783101210ee9ce290ceaad3d4 18 admin 2024-09-11 11:31:49 Setup automatic outbound REST message​STRY0010068 STRY0010068 asap 62accbc783101210ee9ce290ceaad3d4 proceed cancel 3 700000 true application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet Mapping.xlsx 807ebfd54bea45d472f964f6912780f3bab2351855a92973bb9e566785c77555 12004 9226 available admin 2024-09-02 14:56:52 9f57101b83941210ee9ce290ceaad3e7 1 system 2024-09-02 14:56:52 rm_story 62accbc783101210ee9ce290ceaad3d4 H4sIAAAAAAAA/w== 16 0 9f57101b83941210ee9ce290ceaad3e7 admin 2024-09-02 14:56:52 df57101b83941210ee9ce290ceaad3e7  12288 1 9f57101b83941210ee9ce290ceaad3e7 admin 2024-09-02 14:56:52 5357101b83941210ee9ce290ceaad3e8
